sn56.19:0.2: 2. Rolling Forth the Wheel of Dhamma
sn56.19:1.1: “Mendicants, I’ve declared: ‘This is the noble truth of suffering.’
sn56.19:1.2: And there are limitless explanations, phrases, and expressions about that:
sn56.19:1.3: ‘This is another way of saying that this is the noble truth of suffering.’
sn56.19:1.4: I’ve declared: ‘This is the noble truth of the origin of suffering.’ …
sn56.19:1.5: I’ve declared: ‘This is the noble truth of the cessation of suffering.’ …
sn56.19:1.6: I’ve declared: ‘This is the noble truth of the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.’
sn56.19:1.7: And there are limitless explanations, phrases, and expressions about that:
sn56.19:1.8: ‘This is another way of saying that this is the noble truth of the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.’
sn56.19:2.1: That’s why you should practice meditation …”
